titleStmt.title: Mr. George Keith, at Turners-Hall in Philpot-Lane, London, in 1696. Contradicting Mr. George Keith, at the Tolbooth of Aberdeen, in 1688. In fundamental points of the Christian faith. Demonstrated by quotations out of The exact narrative of the proceedings at Turners-Hall, &c. on the one hand: and quotations out of Immediate revelation not ceased, on the other hand. In a letter to himself. / By a moderate church man.
titleStmt.author: Moderate church man.

titleStmt.title: Mr. George Keith, at Turners-Hall in Philpot-Lane, London, in 1696. Contradicting Mr. George Keith, at the Tolbooth of Aberdeen, in 1688. In fundamental points of the Christian faith. Demonstrated by quotations out of The exact narrative of the proceedings at Turners-Hall, &c. on the one hand: and quotations out of Immediate revelation not ceased, on the other hand. In a letter to himself. / By a moderate church man.
titleStmt.author: Moderate church man.
W. C.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed and sold by E. Whitlock, in Stationers-Court, near Stationers-Hall,

notesStmt.note: Imperfect: stained with slight loss of text.
Reproduction of the original in the University of Texas, Austin Library.
